data.title: "telemetry.experiments.showCommandsWatermark" switch not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

My insiders install had command watermarks displayed. Setting  "telemetry.experiments.showCommandsWatermark" : false didn't have any effect.

data.title: Request: Prompt before reverting file
data.body: It would be nice if we could get a "You will lose all changes. Are you sure you want to revert this file?" when using the `workbench.action.files.revert` command. My rationale is that this is a bit like closing a file, do not save, and open it again. (Perhaps this could be an option?)

data.title: Allow workspace relative files.associations setting
Can not use Command-ArrowDown to open an editor from a search match
data.body:
While testing  #12519.
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a folder
2. Shift+Command+F
3. type a search expression with guaranteed matches
4. Tab to the search results view
5. Use ArrowDown and ArrowRight to navigate to a match
6. Use Command-ArrowDown to open the match in an editor
   -> no editor opens

data.title: files.autosave doesn't get toggled for first time
data.body:
Bug found while testing for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12527
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open global setting. Make sure `files.autoSave` entry is not present in user's `settings.json`.
2. Click Files -> Autosave in Menu.
3. `"files.autoSave": "off"` is added. I was expecting the previous Menu click would turn this on.

data.title: Different behaviour of Ctrl+K + Ctrl+C
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607 OS Build: 14393.187

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Doing Ctrl+K + Ctrl+C (for commenting) in line 14 in the end, comments the code in a different way. 
   ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16834561/18885138/00e36302-8508-11e6-8bf4-b3d042604452.png)

data.title: Mention backtick for Watermark Commands Toggle Terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

Customer verbatim suggests that with the Toggle Terminal keyboard shortcut Ctrl+` it isn't obvious that a backtick character is used.

Consider added text to call out the backtick.
Something like:
"Toggle Terminal    Ctrl+`(using the backtick character)"
or more simply:
"Toggle Terminal     Ctrl+` (backtick)

data.title: How does a user know what settings are overridden by an extension?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (f62883f07422cae4b53c2a185b105091460a0a85, 2016-09-27T13:07:11.616Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12614

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set `"terminal.integrated.cursorBlinking": true` in your settings.json
2. Run an extension containing:
   
   ``` ts
   vscode.workspace.getConfiguration()
     .update('terminal.integrated.cursorBlinking', false, false);
   ```
3. Try to figure out why `"terminal.integrated.cursorBlinking": true` is not working
4. File a bug to Microsoft/vscode

data.title: TS error stays around
Watermark command for up/down shouldn't use "or"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

"or" makes sense for Command Palette and Quick Open where there really are two choices.

Stick with "/" to match text "Up/Down" and "Above/Below"

For example:
Move Lines Up/Down            Alt+UpArrow/DownArrow 
Add Cursors Above/Below     Ctrl+Alt+UpArrow/DownArrow

data.title: Clarify global parameter of WorkspaceConfiguration.update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (f62883f07422cae4b53c2a185b105091460a0a85, 2016-09-27T13:07:11.616Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12614

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/d31fc79a5f56f89e12439984d9c176fd5322ffbd/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L2664

It was not immediately clear that the option was between global and _workspace_, I thought it was between global and _window_ (ie. instance) and the change would be discarded after exiting the window.

data.title: Restart debug task doesn't close previous externalTerminal

Bug found while testing #12252

data.title: Release notes for insiders launches a tab, closes it and then launches a web page
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0 (f62883f07422cae4b53c2a185b105091460a0a85, 2016-09-27T13:07:11.616Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12520

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In dev tools Go to Application > Local Storage
2. Set the `storage://global/releasenotes/lastversion` key to 1.5.0
3. Reload window
4. Click the release notes button, a tab will appear and then close before opening a web page

data.title: External terminal not working for debugging node program
'Run in external terminal' does not reuse alternate terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (f62883f07422cae4b53c2a185b105091460a0a85, 2016-09-27T12:46:15.113Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Testing #12252

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run app.js with `process.exit(0);` using iTerm2.app as external terminal
2. Observe: Each time it is run / restarted a new iTerm2 window opens

Using the default Terminal.app a single window is reused.

data.title: [html] closing </script> tag is not proposed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #12100 

```
<!-- Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved. -->
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8" />
        <script>

    </head>
</html>
```

After `<script>` tag type `</` 

Expected closing `</script>` tag is proposed. But not.

data.title: CodeSnippet doesn't support empty brackets anymore - {{}}
[Razor] No coloring for the code in the global scope
Git tab with commit target information
data.body:
Can you output before Message-field (between control buttons and input field) target of next commit - "project/folder name" + "branch name"?
Currently for re-check is target repository is right user have to look:
-  up, to the title bar of VSCode for re-check current project/folder name (in fullscreen mode invisible);
-  down, to the status bar of VSCode for re-check current branch name.

Sample: target: vscode | release/1.5

thank you.

data.title: marked text is not case sensitive
Make it possible to select multiple lines
data.body: Something pretty much every editor has but not vscode is selecting multiple lines, hold the alt key and drag your mouse down or up to select the lines you want. When you start typing the same letters appears on every line.

data.title: tsconfig baseUrl helper is misleading
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Fedora 24

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any project tsconfig.json
2. Into `compilerOptions` add `baseUrl`
3. A helper which should explain what baseUrl does shows a misleading message:

_"Base directory to resolve non absolute names"_

It should show: 
_"Base directory to resolve non-relative module names."_

I tried to search this and Typescript repository for a potential PR but I wasn't successful finding the definition for this message.

data.title: Make commands watermark translatable
data.body: The keybindings are using ' or ' without NLS support.
